ygData.subject: Re: Borxx Lens
ygData.msgSnippet: Heh, I think I am one of the ones that started this thread a ways back there... Anyway, I may have gotten confused due to the fact that as a newbie I was
ygData.messageBody:
Heh, I think I am one of the ones that started this thread a ways back
there...
Anyway, I may have gotten confused due to the fact that as a newbie I
was attempting to do the quest (hey I was level 4, how was I to know
that Verant quest people are evil?) and was running around to all the
NPC's in the observatories asking if they "had any spare lenses" and one
of the mentions that Borxx's retina would make a perfect lens. hence my
confusion.
/Nos

Joshua Bednarz wrote:
>
> From: "Joshua Bednarz" <thewhitemage@...>
>
> Let's get this straight. I DO know what I'm talking about.
>
> The Borxx lens has nothing to do with the telescope quest.
> The telescope lens has nothing to do with the staff quest.
>
> They are completely different. Just because there is a lens involved DOES
> not mean that they are related. One is a lens made of biological material
> that is gotten off of an evil eye named Borxx, if I'm not mistaken.
>
> The others are 4 telescope lenses made of glass, probably made by the
> gnomes.
>
> A piece of glass for a telescope lens couldn't be substituted with a lens
> from a living things eye, just as the lens of an eye could not be
> substituted with a glass lens (and no contacts only assist is correcting
> your vision problems which are caused by the actual eye lens). That is all
> there is two it -- end of story. The two quests are completely seperate and
> have absolutely nothing to do with each other. So if you want to talk about
> how to get the Staff of the Observers, then maybe you should subscribe to a
> mailing list that is interested in it. This is a tinkering list, so unless
> you have some kind of evidence that The Staff is involed in a tinkering
> quest, then lets drop it, ok?
>
> Sniffledoo Copperheart. 14th rank warrior of The Gemchopper Hall --
> Veeshan
>
